results.firPara: The financial context for Leicester Citys sacking of Claudio Ranieri has been highlighted in the clubs 2015-16 accounts, which show record income of £129m over the year City sensationally won the Premier League title.
results.secPara: That revenue, a 24% increase on £104m made the previous season, was boosted by £95m in TV income alone, with much of the extra millions earned from the additional money paid to clubs for each place they finish in the table.
results.webTitle: Leicester City’s Premier League title brings in record £129m income

results.firPara: Zlatan Ibrahimovic has been charged with violent conduct by the Football Association for his elbow on Tyrone Mings during Manchester Uniteds 1-1 draw with Bournemouth. Mings has been charged with the same offence for stamping on the United strikers head.
results.secPara: The flashpoints occurred within moments of each other during a surprisingly spiteful contest at Old Trafford on Saturday and were missed by the referee, Kevin Friend. The official submitted his report to the FA on Monday morning and said he had not seen them. A panel of three former elite referees watched the footage independently and unanimously agreed charges should be brought.
results.webTitle: Zlatan Ibrahimovic and Tyrone Mings charged with violent conduct by FA

results.firPara: A remarkable save preserved the win for Napoli at Roma. It might yet prove a turning point for a side that had lost three games in four
results.secPara: Well get to Dries Mertens and his two goals. Well get to the bit where he dropped on to all fours and cocked his leg towards the corner flag like a dog preparing to empty its bladder, as well. Well get to talking about 21-year-old Marko Rog, too, and his star turn in midfield. Well get to discussing how Maurizio Sarri nailed his team selection, while Luciano Spallettis gamble backfired.
results.webTitle: Pepe Reina gives Napoli a big helping hand with The Save | Paolo Bandini

results.firPara: The whole Schmidt ride at Bayer Leverkusen has been a rollercoaster of soaring peaks and alarming troughs. Alas, the dips had become the norm
results.secPara: It ended on a Tuesday night, 21 February. The looks that the Bayer Leverkusen players exchanged on the turf at the final whistle – at least, of those that could bear to make eye contact – after a spirited but vain second-half rally against Atlético Madrid in the Champions League, spelled it loud and clear. It was all over; not only for Leverkusen in Europe but for their coach Roger Schmidts tenure.
results.webTitle: Roger Schmidt’s reluctant goodbye inevitable as Leverkusen unravel | Andy Brassell

results.firPara: The Togo international has just saved a players life in the Czech Republic, the fourth time he has done so in his eight-year career. Never run away if something bad happens, he tells Dominic Fifield
results.secPara: The Togo international has just saved a players life in the Czech Republic, the fourth time he has done so in his eight-year career. Never run away if something bad happens, he tells Dominic Fifield
results.webTitle: Francis Koné, the footballer who has now saved the lives of four opponents

results.firPara: • Club feel five-point plan made since violence marred EFL Cup tie has worked
results.secPara: West Ham United are confident the increased security measures they have put in place will ensure their Premier League match against Chelsea at the London Stadium on Monday night will be free of the hooliganism that marred the previous meeting between the clubs.
results.webTitle: West Ham confident there will be no repeat of fan trouble against Chelsea

results.firPara: After two seemingly harsh sackings at Leeds and Wigan, the German is making the most of unheralded players to move Fleetwood into a promotion place
results.secPara: Whatever happens from here, this has been a landmark season for Fleetwood Town under Uwe Rösler. The German, despite inheriting a squad that secured its League One future only on the final day of last season, and having seven days to prepare for this campaign, is threatening to exit the division via the preferred route.
results.webTitle: Uwe Rösler finds his place to put spring into unfashionable Fleetwood | Richard Gibson

results.firPara: Todays tell-all has never thrown a training-ground tantrum

results.webTitle: Football transfer rumours: Alexis Sánchez to Paris Saint-Germain?

results.firPara: Hulls Harry Maguire is dreaming of England, Spurs are better placed than ever to best Arsène Wengers Arsenal and Aitor Karanka continues to divide opinion

results.firPara: Zlatan Ibrahimovic and Tyrone Mings can expect to discover on Monday whether they will be charged with violent conduct by the Football Association, with the Bournemouth defender at risk of a lengthier ban.
results.secPara: The Manchester United top scorer faces the prospect of a three-match domestic suspension, which would have been his sanction if he had been sent off for elbowing the Bournemouth defender in the 1-1 draw on Saturday and which would rule him out of the FA Cup quarter-final against Chelsea next Monday as well as the Premier League matches against Middlesbrough and West Bromwich Albion.
results.webTitle: Zlatan Ibrahimovic and Tyrone Mings wait on referee’s report to FA
